ByDBpWEvgXhwAAOSj4eNzQ.text: Came here twice and I have to say that it is such a lovely spot for lunch or dinner. What I like the most is probably the decor. Its spacious and well lit and has this nice but casual feel to it (if that makes any sense). Came here with one of my friend who is hmm a "picky eater" and she even really liked this place. The pizzas and the salads are delicious. The pizza size is great for one person who is hungry or enough to share with a salad or appetizer. One of my friend had the watermelon cocktail and it's the perfect summer drink: lightly sweetened and refreshing.  Have not tried their roast chicken yet but will come back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Aviator. Very. Meaty. Bacon was a tad bit overcooked but pizza was good overall.

fJAqtltxCk4QctX4M97yWA.text: Outstanding!  Brought a large group in and the food was great!  Service was excellent as well.  Highly recommend!

QY1mStbDDgSVJRdGLu9m5g.text: I LOVE THE CHICKEN! It is soo good! And service here is top notch. Waitstaff is knowledgeable about food preparation, ingredients, and I feel comfortable taking my son, who has multiple allergies, here to eat.

uIimByop2cqy8LQSxL_P7g.text: So my first experience at Doughbird was during their opening week and left much to be desired. However, I later talked with the manager (he couldn't have been more attentive and wonderful) who assured me that my next visit would be different, and to please try them again to restore my confidence and palate in Doughbird and Fox restaurants.   Tonight we went back and our experience was fantastic! We were greeted warmly and seated at a comfortable booth in the middle of the restaurant. Soon thereafter our waiter arrived, got us drinks, and took our orders. We had cesar salads, bread and butter, salmon, chicken with jalapeno pesto and potato wedges, brussel sprouts and kale, and the prime rib dip sandwich with potato wedges. Every single thing we ordered was flawless! The chicken was tender, moist, and full of flavor, the salmon was cooked beautifully, and the prime rib sandwich melted in my mouth; absolutely delicious! This was my first introduction to jalapeno pesto, but now I am quite sure my life has been forever changed because of it! It was a complete turnaround from our previous visit.   My only knock is that the food comes out pretty slowly, so hopefully you enjoy the company you are with. They just opened however, so maybe this will improve with time.   Thanks to the wonderful management and the incredible food I will be back many times to come!

osxZ8UkqkMTWSZQEwNbZCA.text: Good gluten free pizza but would be nice to have more options featuring the chicken. Service was amazing. Everyone was incredibly friendly.

3HPQuvVQzYHI8EFnC5RQ2g.text: Had lunch here today.  I would give it more than 5 stars if I could.  It was REALLY good!  Two of us shared the Barbecue chicken pizza and Buffalo chicken wings.  There was enough left over for a 3rd person.  My only criticism would be that it was a little pricey.  Maybe rate it $$$ and not $$.  $44.53 for lunch for two people and we drank lemonade.  Oh, but we did share a dessert.  The lemon meringue pie was sooo delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wJSfgr9SAb7wStqYT5OYXg.text: I honestly didn't want to eat here because the mashup of a chicken and pizza place seemed weird AF to me.  Actually, it is still crazy to me.  I mean what's next?  A marshmallow and rib place?  All that nonsense aside, I actually really enjoyed this place.  The atmosphere, service, and food were all great.  Especially the food.  It isn't fancy and there aren't an overwhelming number of choices.  Basically just a few unique (but nothing crazy) pizzas, salads, and rotisserie chicken.  I tried something from every category and every item was delicious.  There is not a bad choice on the menu and I hope to return soon.

xPYq8sKEpTX5ezI5djaQLw.text: So I've have visited most of the Fox Concept's restaurants in the Valley and when I heard Doughbird opened up, I wanted to give it a try......and I was not impressed.  So I my wife and I wanted to get out and try something new.  I heard about this a while back from a co-worker, so we agreed to give this place a try.  So we stopped by on a Saturday afternoon.  The place wasn't that busy and we were seated pretty quickly.  From that point on, everything was a disappointment, from the lack luster service to the crappy food.  So we sat there for roughly 10 minutes before a waitress said.."She'll be right with us"  About another 5 minutes goes by.  She finally comes by.  She took down our drink orders and said "She'll be back to take our orders"  My wife and I reviewed the menu, wasn't really impressed, cause they mostly had pizza and chicken, with a few sandwich and salad choices.  If I wanted pizza, I would just go to the other FOX restaurant...North. So we finally flagged down the busboy to let the waitress know we are still waiting for our waters and we are ready to order.  So from first sitting down to ordering it literally took over 25 minutes.  Anyways, we wanted to give the food a chance, cause if the food is great, we can overlook the sh*tty service.  So we came here what they are known for.  We ordered the full rotisserie chicken for 24.00, since half of a chicken was 17.00 (wouldn't make much sense to order the half), we ordered the brussesl sprout with kale for 5.00 and the Prime Rib Dip for 17.00.  So after all that fiasco, the food finally came out........  The rotisserie chicken was cut nicely and looked amazing.  When you bit into it, the chicken was dry and had a weird gaming taste. It definitely didn't taste like the rotisserie chicken's I was used to. and I get them at Frys, Costco, Sprouts, and Whole Foods.  I would much rather eat chicken's from those places than coming back to here, and for 24.00 bucks, you can kiss my a$$.  The prime rib dip sandwich was a disgrace to its name.  It was dry and the sandwich fell apart.  It tastes more like dry roast beef than prime rib. Go to Stockyards or Charlestons or a REAL prime rib sandwich. The potato wedges were bland and cold.  Feel like they were out of the fryer for quite some time.  The side dish, brussels sprouts were decent and flavorful, but for 5 bucks, I'll pass next time.  Overall, what do you want me to say?  24.00 for a rotisserie chicken that you can spend 5.00 bucks at Costco, or 7.00 at Frys, or splurge and get a range free, organic chicken at Whole Foods for 15.00 bucks.  17.00 bucks for a wilted dried up sandwich?  What a joke.  That sandwich will probably go down as one of my worst sandwiches I've ever ate in my life.  Much rather gone to Fry's and get some Boarshead and cheese and made my own damn sandwich.  So combination of crappy service and overpriced chicken, this is a Fox Concept restaurant i will not be going back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib sandwich
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken

l9RT1V0AU5Qsqz1OWANRWg.text: Great atmosphere, good service, and all around trendy. I've been here once, and it was a good experience, but I am not dying to go here again....The food was decent, fairly interesting with all of the sauce options, but overall pretty salty and bland. I have a theory that all of the Fox restaurants are really the same food, just presented differently and tweaked a little bit. Oh, and you need a reservation. We waited about an hour for a party of 3 on a Tuesday.

5sxgda3HHgmJb1U6KEcjlg.text: -hey yelp!-- the name of this restaurant is not Doughbird.    It's Dough Bird. Sorta like calling a Suzanne, Susan. It's not correct.   11/31/2017--  Did the whole she-bang: 1 whole chicken, 2 sides, 2 sauces, Chardonnay...$60 for me, 1 person, that is w/ tip.   The chicken is excellent. There is no way around it, no reason to try and find a way around it; the chicken is excellent.   Sauces: The boys in the band--which is to say the guys behind bar--they like the jalapeno sauce the best -- I thought it was good, nowhere near great. The cream fraiche sauce is just fabulous. Maybe my severe acid reflux has so badly jaded my taste buds that only things with horseradish taste good...?   But I'll tell you this: I think that sauce is terrific!!  Mashed potatoes: somebody somewhere is going to say they've had better mashed potatoes but I'll tell you this much: these are pretty good. And while you're eating these mashed potatoes you can't eat anybody else's mashed potatoes so these these will do just fine.   Note: restaurants nowadays I notice far too frequently people touching their face, their hair, their person, and the first thing you learn in any food handlers situation is that hands! are the number one method of transmission of colds and flu. So it freaks me out when I see people doing touching their person. The restaurants know better, Mgt too, personnel has been instructed better, hell! they had to pass a test just to work there!  Having said that, Dough Bird get a really good grade, nice job, on behalf of the employees PROPERLY following simple food handlers protocol.   I LIKE THIS SPOT. I don't know if it's a good value but it's good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 1 whole chicken. My question is, can you get it I dissected?
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted, candies broccoli. Damn!
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really good mashed potatoes. Sinful!

eW1CrjD7ig8sSub8fQ-i_A.text: My boyfriend and I came here on recommendation of one of my coworkers and honestly this place is so nice. Our server Hunter was super great. We had some of their cocktails where were superb! I am not  a huge fan of liquor drinks but I would recommend these. We also got the hummus which was very good. I really wanted to  say thank  you to Hunter and the manger that was there for being so accommodating when we didn't 100% love what we ordered. We tried to just get a box and take it, but not only did the waiter ask if we're wanted something else, but his  boss insisted and had our pizza remade and it was amazing! Generally I don't have a problem requesting something be fixed, but the pizza was not made poorly in the first place, we just didn't know the bbq pizza would be so sweet. But it is one of there most popular pizzas so we decided to go for it. So this has got quite lengthy; YOU GUYS ARE AWESOME

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fFrlkyJkv4LRFsX0ZOK7Ag.text: Another great Fox restaurant.   Great open atmosphere with even better food.   The concept is simple and straight forward.    The menu features the best Rotisserie Chicken you've ever tasted along with some fantastic wood fired pizzas.  My wife had the White pizza and it was somewhat mind blowing!  There are some nice looking sandwiches on the menu and others have raved about the prime rib but I haven't deviated from getting the Rotisserie Chicken each time as it's that good!   PS.  Try the umami sauce with your Chicken.   If only they bottled it for consumption at home!   OMG!!!!

6q0Ef1oTn9BLaIcuT4eNCA.text: Fantastic food and service!  We didn't feel rushed.  We felt well attended to.  The food was delicious.  I even went back the next day to get another pizza for lunch!  Keep up the great work.

16MX-0dvF-ghhEK-o1ynng.text: Welcome to the neighborhood doughbird! I wasn't exactly sure what to expect when I saw this place open up, but I was definitely happy with my decision to check it out.   1. Parking - This place is popular, so carpool with your friends or take a Lyft because parking is sparse. You're going to a cool new hip place, so take some cool new hip transportation while you're at it.   2. Alcohol - I picked the "Afternoon Tea". It had peach sake in it! So delicious and I want to drink it again. If you like sake, you'll like this sweet sake cocktail.   3. Food - You've probably read the other reviews but OMG the Brussel Sprout pizza. Get it, savor it, and then wonder why you didn't order two. The cheese Stromboli as an appetizer was sooo delicious but I wouldn't recommend if you're also ordering pizza.   4. Ambience - The interior design in this restaurant took my breath away. All the details from the plates to the seating, to the windows, it's all tasteful and very beautiful to look at while here.   I want to go back to doughbird with my friends and share a chicken! You should grab some friends and head here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Afternoon tea and the margarita
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute plates!
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stromboli and Brussel Sprout pizza! :)

alm_4UcJzvHUadaKIVy4Cw.text: Wonderful server Brigid. They specialize in pizza so I ordered a Pepperoni Meat combo pizza & my friend ordered a Marguerite pizza. We both agreed- both pizzas were absolutely awful. The crust was hard & like a frozen pizza. We both agreed Pizza Hut is far better & I haven't eaten Pizza Hut in 10 years. Really bad crust, awful toppings. We won't be back. How is this place in business still? Pictured are the leftovers for take-home but thy will not be eaten. If the management is interested in offering pizza, they should dine at the best valley pizzerias then compare it to their product. For starters, check out the crust, sauce & ingredients used at Pizzeria Bianco. I can't teach you anything but your competition can.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bWrMMvQUAbRyaKc1lf6wgg.text: So my brother and I, who are both vegan, just ate here. The staff is amazing and helping us find something that fit our dietary restrictions. We got the mushroom pizza with olive oil instead of sauce. It was absolutely amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom pizza with olive oil and no cheese

34mTUuXhhRaxAwnHGwHVFw.text: I've been to Doughbird twice.  I'm usually a Fox Restaurant Concepts fan.  But they missed the mark today.  I, along with two others, had lunch.  I ordered their signature roasted chicken and mashed potatoes.  Sounded good on a cold (as cold as we get in Arizona) winter day.  Unfortunately, my chicken, once I cut into it fully, was bloody and uncooked.  I told the server, she offered to get me another one, but we were already running late and needed to leave.  She told me she was going to let the chef know, because it was unacceptable. I assumed they'd take it off the bill.  I was disappointed and embarased, since my friends paid, that they didn't take the uncooked chicken entree off the bill.  I think when something comes out of the kitchen that bad, you don't charge for it.  I don't know who's call it was to keep the charge in place, but it was the wrong one.  I will go again, but next time, I will make sure the chicken is thoroughly cooked; I would advise you to do the same.

K7uPB6395yVMTK9dbDMd3w.text: Great place with a great atmosphere! Loved the pizza and the potato wedges. Only downside is that I was eating my pizza too fast and I bit my tongue and now it hurts. Oh well, it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Me and bisalo and pizza

ASUrSpCNS5hF6rLeFXELjw.text: Once again, Sam Fox nails it with Dough Bird. I have yet to go to a Fox Restaurant I didn't like. I'll admit I'm a total fan girl!  My husband and I stopped into Dough Bird on a Thursday night around 7 and the place was packed. But luckily we only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.  We decided we needed to try the dough and the bird so we got a pizza and a half chicken. The pizza was pepperoni and burrata. It had great flavor and the crust was done perfectly. The pepperoni made it a little greasy but not too bad. It certainly didn't stop us from devouring it. The chicken was delish. Really juicy and the skin was nicely browned. We had the pineapple teriyaki sauce which was awesome. I could eat a whole bunch of that stuff. And for our side we went with the mac and cheese which was super good. I could eat a bunch of that stuff too.   Friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere and great food. You can't go wrong.

0PsKn3O3AVNsqS9NEwI6gg.text: As others have said, the large windows allowing sunlight to spread across the entire restaurant is REALLY nice! The ambiance here, is on point. Despite a small hiccup with our wings coming late (Manager kindly took them off our bill) the service was impeccable. However... next time we come, we'll skip the dough and go for the bird. Both of our pizzas were overcooked to the point where the toppings were hard and chewy. The avocado chicken salad was one of the best salads I have ever had. Same with the wings. Ah Mazin!

zVmADOzI7gAhlwB4SShWfg.text: We have had awesome service and food every time we have frequented this joint. The atmosphere is perfect in every aspect, layout, design, space, noise dampening, etc. Most importantly the service is dialed in, as well as the food and menu, prices are spot on for what you get in this dining experience. This has become a go to for us, so don't hesitate and give it a try, and you might just become a regular.

tyJS45PoKq6nl35yteaG1g.text: Absolutely enjoyed my first visit....  Signature cocktails all looked amazing; I tried the Local and it packed a punch! A fresh and crisp beverage. We tried the hummus to start and couldn't get over how smooth and silky it was (I usually skip Hummus because it's gritty) The cauliflower mash was tasty and creamy. Also went for the  Margharita pizza; the burata was creamy and yummy, sauce on the pizza is a simple tomato, and the crust, 'The Dough' was some of the best I've had of late. The Rotisserie or 'The Bird' is just as it should be, well seasoned, moist and falling off the bone. We didn't try the prime rib but plan to soon!! Our service was stellar. We can't wait to go back. Enjoy!! It's fantastic!

EBxmD51vyiSnRkle-iBJ1Q.text: Fox RC does it again. So good. We tried the Brussel sprout pizza with a side of the jalapeno pesto and the hummus. Both were delicious and will definitely be reordered. We sat at the kitchen bar top area and enjoyed watching all of the other menu choices as they were prepared. Service was attentive per most Fox restaurants. Menu seemed to have a lot to offer to everyone. Definitely worth the visit!

iLxZIkuHTsrrIJOmHGkSXg.text: I knew this place was always busy but I don't normally seek rotisserie chicken when I want to go out to eat. I was in the area and hungry so my friend and I decided to give it a try. The decor is nice, it is bright and has plenty of room. I wasn't sure we would get a seat, as it was of course busy. We walked in and were promptly greeted and asked if we had a reservation, uh oh, no we don't, but that was ok, the hostess found us a nice booth, YAY. We were quickly greeted by our waitress and offered a beverage. She asked if we had dined there before to which we replied no, she then began explaining the menu and answered our questions. We decided to share a salad and a pizza. Normally salads are just that, a salad and nothing to write home about, but not this salad. The rotisserie chicken was moist and flavorful, fresh avocado, the tomatoes were delicious. The pizza had sausage and pepperoni and was big enough for us to share. The sausage and pepperoni were spicy, which was ok but unexpected. The greatest part of the pizza is that dough. It was delicious and addicting.

FKP0z3wbwFaJkj9tMftw9w.text: This place has delicious pizza, salads and desserts! No wonder they are always so busy! The food is well worth the wait. If you are dining alone or it's just the two of you, try sitting at the bar. You get quicker service and if the food is taking long, then at least you can keep ordering drinks. #lifehack for you right there! The staff is very friendly and the food is delicious.

OHIRQqeHGt4yhXhUHrzplw.text: 1st time tonight. Great place. Decor is contemporary and comfortable. Service is excellent and our waiter very helpful discussing menu items. The food was great. Our party had the 1/2 chicken, chicken club sandwich, a pepperoni pizza and a pumpkin and Brussels sprout pizza. Also had a fantastic cheese stromboli appetizer and cocktails. Everything was first rate. Reasonable prices and a place we'll definately return to.

x_7kNCVEU_kAnuauesNr5w.text: Boy was this place crowded. Grabbed the last 2 spots at the bar and it was on. Took them a while to take the orders, both drinks and meal. The service was nice but not engaging. Specials were not volunteered or advertised visually before being asked what we want. I like to know what's available in order to make a decision. Shared a chicken Caesar salad, cauliflower mash, and potato wedges. The potatoes were not warm, the cauliflower was bland and the salad was a good Caesar with some rotisserie chicken added. All in all so unremarkable with the flavors. A beautifully trussed open ceiling acts as an amplifier for all the noises in the room. Not pleasant when crowded. I'll likely try again, but not for a while.

_CCwN2tYtFR40Zk-yhvcGw.text: Phenomenal food and service. Kim was awesome and well versed with the menu, Kolin made great recommendations with the menu, and we loved everything we had. Artichoke Pizza was the best!

CNccaEQwuKxywW0H_hbK1g.text: Really bad food and highly over priced. Didn't try the pizza but had a BBQ chicken sandwich that was unpleasant and other guests had pastrami sandwich and some other sandwich that wasn't memorable.   The cauliflower appetizer was ok, best thing about it was the pesto side sauce.   Also upon entering It took a few minutes for one the 4 girls standing there to address us which felt uncomfortable.   First and last time we'll try this fox concept.   horrible parking for the plaza as well.   This one may have too many strikes against them to sustain

NTNAoaSyaMPfh7sdAlwzVw.text: Fox's newest concept specializes in pizza and rotisserie and doesn't stray far from the formula that has led to its other restaurants' success.  The menu includes a range of salads, sandwiches, veggies and sauces.  The food was definitely tasty, although the portions were underwhelming.  We ended up ordering extra sides of brussels and cauliflower mash (which was the best thing I tried).  The interior is sleek and comfortable.  I'll probably come back.

6XcAw89C6JsfpnTz2PAXXA.text: Had the Prime Rib Dip, an ok sandwich, but charging $17.00 is crazy.  It's an $8.00 sandwich. Don't order it. Not enough prime rib and what's on sandwich is skimpy amount.   I have had the chicken too.  It doesn't stand out.  So far typical Fox Concept.  Great atmosphere, cool design, menu "seems" inspiring but end product is average.

LUj3aOtGxs2vIMtuGgbe1g.text: Our first time at Doughbird was a very good dining experience.  The restaurant has the usual professional style of most Sam Fox Restaurants.  The dining room is comfortable and contemporary.  The service staff is young, energetic and well-trained to properly attend to the customer.  Sam Fox Restaurants are great at attaining the highest level of customer service in their hiring and training.  The combination of pizza and rotisserie chicken is a great concept.  A nice approach is to order both items at your table and share them together.  The side dishes are perfect and the salads are fresh, chrispy and delicious.  The desserts are creative and satisfying.  Prices are a bit high - $17 for a half chicken, $15 for a pizza and $8.25 for a IPA draft beer.  With this price structure we won't be back as often as we would like, but we will return again.

eHtSZnamAjIvJ_STOjPUgQ.text: Very fun environment and atmosphere.  We loved the decorating.  The restaurant is completely open, which creates some noise, but it's that perfect level that you can still talk.  The food was amazing.  We had to try a pizza and chicken, both are worth getting.  The side mac and cheese is a must.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UFAToKQW50ZgYFva4gDatA.text: I have been wanting to try this place for some time now and had the opportunity while visiting my Mom and Sister.  Bad mistake,  service was ok, nothing to write home or yelp about.  Didn't get the chance to try the pizza so we went with rotisserie chicken meals.  What really disappointed me at this point was there was no aroma to tease.  You figure a place that makes pizza and has chicken slowly rotating on a spit would make the taste buds perk up, but nada.  Being a fan of Brussel Sprouts I choose that side (I know yuck but I love them if they're done right) with my order but they were pretty much unedible and burned to a crisp.  The bottom line, you will be better off going with the major chain that sells rotisserie chickens for half the price plus you get the option of 2 sides there, but here just 1.  The chicken was lacking in flavor and was not worth the nearly $20 price, so sad to say this is not a place for these taste buds.  Hopefully the pizza is better but I guess I won't be finding out.

KXu28YccBZ820wL04CwP2Q.text: I had the wild mushroom pizza that was recommended by one of the employees. That pizza was very good and the dough was light sp it was not hard to finish the whole personal pizza. I will be back.

HC1RdnqMER3X1GkN7I0aeg.text: The pizza was very different than other pizzas in a good way and had nice crispy potato wedges. Nice atmosphere and very aesthetically pleasing. Good service

Fcz_yDPWt5RCB-4JRUOOOQ.text: Omg my new favorite place for lunch or dinner!!!!! Beyond excited and pleased with the quality of choices on the menu. The Brussels sprouts and kale is delicious. My favorite pizza is the pastrami is to die for. They only have one tv so for those of you who will like sports go somewhere else. Those of you who have woman outings must have. They might have a long wait but definitely worth the wait. Bar seating is fun as you get to watch all the action.

LJSTbe0ROkepYSdkDRQKBA.text: Couldn't wait to try great rotisserie and pizza as I pass by daily. Got 1/2 rotisserie chic. At $17 would expect the best ever- - was on the dry side and small.  The Brussel sprout pizza was just ok according to my friend.  The beautiful chopped garden salad was a bit disappointing.   Any chef knows that you have to  season as you go to elevate the flavors of all foods; I think this step was forgotten. All those beautiful ingredients were crying for that punch. Nicole, our waiter, was awesome.  She knew the menu inside and out. The restaurant itself  is clean and sleek. Been there, done that.

8szvv50snzicXCA-31g11w.text: Went with some friends for Galentines last night and had some amazing food. The truffle stromboli was so good!!! The brussel sprout pizza my friend got was like a taste explosion in my mouth. Sweet from the sweet potato, salty from bacon, your taste buds were awoken when you first bit into it. I had the prime rib dip that was good as well, but nothing special. My other friend had the crispy pastrami and that was good as well. Good service and good food. I would go back to try other items.

RVLeT3oqUfInFO5WocvOcQ.text: The best way to describe our experience for dinner was average. The salad was good, but small. The pizzas sounded amazing but we're okay and not packed with flavor and crunch. There are many other options not far like humble pie, parlor and more much better. The chicken is like a rotisserie chicken from Costco (which is pretty decent i must say) but with good sauces. Desert menu limited. Service seemed disorganized but it's still early being one month open. This restaurant group has some winners like the Henry, but unfortunately this may not be one of them.

A5Y23oQa_4H-6y_h_UX_7g.text: Food was very good an it is easy to eat here on a paleo diet. Love that they use local ingredients and the server was able to answer all of my questions and make the changes I needed. We went for lunch and were seated right away but it still was a long process of over an hour so not good on a lunch break.

R_EcSFjBP8QbxsDYwJyo5w.text: Of course, any Sam Fox restaurant is going to generate hype. Doughbird was featured on many TV shows and reviewed extensively. We had dinner here tonight, and here is my assessment. The interior is just stunning. You almost felt that you were by the sea with the light woods, beautiful floor and beadboard walls. The service is very, very good. Our server was just wonderful, knew the menu and was attentive. But the food is just average. After hearing about all of Sam's research on dishes to feature here, I was so disappointed. We started with the Garden Salad. It was fine, but too dry for my liking, thus tasteless. It was mainly vegtables, so at least it was healthy. Then our margarita pizza, half Italian sausag, came out and my first impression was that it tasted like Pomo, another restaurant in the Valley. Just average at best. The spots of fresh mozzarella is nice, but not enough to make this pizza really good. We had dessert, some peach strusel with a very small (not enough) scoop of vanilla ice cream. We won't be back unless friends want to try. Just not worth the drive or wait.

1GNnS2IHwmHk7JzGZlhggA.text: Thanks, Sam. I was skeptical of how this concept would come together, but you pulled it off. Tonight was my fourth visit and the experience was on point. First let me say that I love the coordination of servers, and tonight Ryan gave a stellar performance. I wish I remembered the staff from previous visits to mention them as well.  Great job, people. I've had the prime rib, rotisserie chicken, and several pizzas including the Burrata, Aviator, Margherita, and Spiral Ham. Being from Chicago, I don't like people messing with my pizza but these are worth it. Not too doughy, not too saucy, not too cheesy. The rotisserie chicken has been moist both times I've had it. I love getting at least three sauces to go with it. The cauliflower mash is awesome. The truffle cheese Stromboli to start with is a great idea....ours was a little small for the price but the flavor was pleasantly surprising. I've also had the wings which you think would be typical, but not at all. They are very worth tasting. We'll be back again for another pitcher of Moon To go along with the smorgasbord.

5m837WHpetfuUMXAMY0T-w.text: Listen, if this wasn't a Sam Fox restaurant it would be closed already. My only question is - do we really need a new restaurant that specializes in rotisserie chicken and pizza? If I am gonna get rotisserie chicken I can by a whole bird at Walmart that's pretty darn good for $5.99. Why in Gods name would I want to pay $17 for half a bird and a side and if I am going to pay $16 for a pizza I am going to Grimaldis. I had the prime rib dip for $17. First of all, the portion size of the prime rib was minimal and I got well done prime rib when I specifically asked for medium rare. The sandwich itself didn't taste like the prime rib dips I grew up with in NY. This sandwich was served in a pita pocket and the arugula just gave the sandwich an odd aftertaste. Even if it had tasted good, it would have not been worth the $17 I paid for it which I am sure will go to pay back the money that was spent to buy the land and build this place. If this place makes it then I will be amazed! I think Doughbird will suffer the same fate Modern Steak did.

b_FAIdKxPrwCoqlo9BhN4g.text: like most of the Fox restaurants - well executed, great food and super friendly staff.

x-qApkVu1ckf7I0oJ9lROg.text: We went to Dough Bird for the first time on Mother's Day. The food was very good. I had the prime rib which was cooked perfectly accompanied by au jus and horseradish sauce. My wife had a salad with the rotisserie chicken. She said it was very good. Here's where they can improve service. There were 5 of us at the table. The server brought out 2 meals. A couple minutes later the 3rd meal was delivered and a couple minutes later the final 2 meals were delivered. I don't know why restaurant servers don't understand that this creates an uncomfortable situation at the table with the people who get their meals first wondering if they should eat or wait for the others. Please bring all the meals at once. The other thing I observed is the server bringing the dessert, served in a bowl, with his thumb in the bowl. I saw it at our table and at the table next to ours. Not a fan of fingers in my food.

fPytgHdLh1Y8fEj62IuXUQ.text: This is one of my new favorite places to eat! The interior is very cute and the food is scrumptious. I can't wait to go back. Great food and service! Will be planning another date night here very soon.

jc7ob14s_VooaBwVQO7cLw.text: We are visiting from California and I wish we had a place like this to go!!  Love, love everything about it! Service, food, ambiance. It is a must!

Fv_rxjj_rzP_pPu11Fv61w.text: This is a fantastic spot for pizza and chicken. Has a very nice patio, open when weather is good. Service is great. Get the Brussels sprouts and the BBQ chicken pizza with marinara sauce instead of BBQ sauce. I also would not reccomend the mashed potatoes, but the cauliflower mash is superb. It is amazing if you love good pizza and chicken. Definitely recommend dough bird.

Wp9L8-aQlbVepANC_XwyYw.text: Came today for a late lunch with my family. Place was busy but thankfully,we had reservations. Our server was great with suggestions since it was the first time we've been here. Husband and son chose a pizza. Hubby had the pastrami pizza and my son had the pepperoni pizza. They both really enjoyed it. My daughter had the BBQ chicken sandwich with a side of mac n cheese. She is very picky with food and she was extremely pleased with her choice. I chose the 1/2 chicken with the lemon & garlic dipping sauce and the asparagus/broccolini side. Chicken was perfect and the dipping sauce was excellent.  It was probably the best chicken I've had in a long time. The broccolini/asparagus was cooked perfect. Finally we split The Elvis for dessert and it was delicious. I definitely would recommend Dough Bird. We had such a wonderful experience today!

1u1iJ1X5lt3DeT3N0eTpcQ.text: The name says it all, cause you better have doe that you don't mind flying away.  Start with the + side.  The food was tasty and they carry one of my fave beers on tap, local San tans moon  juice.  Now the reason they get 3 .  I have had many wings in my day, some great and some not worth even mentioning, I've never had $12 wings and then be charged $1 for each dipping sauce (I got 3 cause the wings were naked), in fact McDonalds is the only place I've ever been charged for dipping sauce, they should make that known because I got 2 sauces that came with it, I didn't even eat.  I will chalk that up to the service and a lost star, there were other issues with the service as well, like it took them about 15mins to ask if we were thirsty, and when we got our pizza it was not made how we ordered it.  The food was a bit salty as well, not salty to were it tasted funny, salty as in when we left I needed to drink about a gallon of water so I didn't shrivel up, the additional star lost.  This place seems kid friendly although it wasn't busy so keep that in mind!  Pretty modern but the decor is also cliche, I live in the east valley and drove about 30mins to check this place out, I will not be doing that again, but I may give them a second chance if I'm on that side of town.  And remember this place is a bit pricey so be prepared to spend that bird doe!

ErCOw6JfIQ71hpQGhnnggg.text: It was date afternoon with my hubby and we've been waiting to try Dough Birds.  He's a pizza buff and me, I always want to try something new.  We were both happy with his pizza and my prime rib sandwich.  Perfectly orchestrated to delight the culinary senses.  Our wait staff was efficient.  The atmosphere is relaxing.  Good job Sam Fox

8vZL5Clxa2turVyi6IOi3g.text: I wanted to like the place more but the food was just Ok. I'm a pizza lover and I would have it every day if I could. We drove by this place and it was cute, had a nice vibe and so we gave it a shot. I stick to the basics and got a cheese. It was average. Others in the group got some of the specials and gluten free offerings. They seemed happier with their selections.

A5WKeVu3hiMCL553aQ8xQQ.text: LOVE Doughbird. The truffled egg pizza is a must-try.   My bf and I went for our 2 year anniversary and the service and food were both exceptional. We'll be back again soon!

1zY9jO4tC7MBli9xZqefxg.text: If you're looking to eat the chicken, don't come here. It's basically a Costco chicken with dipping sauces. Yes, the chicken is free range, but it is not restaurant worthy. Also the whole bird will fill not up one person. I repeat DO NOT split the whole chicken. I had to order a pizza to fill myself up.  If you want to try this place out maybe come at happy hour :)

vraUkBVbIaDJnO6_i3cyCQ.text: Went there Sunday afternoon and we will be back!  The chicken was fantastic and the prime rib was amazing, as were the sides of mashed potatoes and buttery corn.  Our meals were so good we decided to take out two other items for dinner...a prime rib sandwich and a chicken/avocado salad...both excellent.    The prime rib sandwich was one of the absolute best sandwiches I've ever had...extremely flavorful and cooked to perfection.  Would highly recommend!

43cXUbH2zAfSTR5DxeL_CA.text: Another great Fox Restaurant Concepts restaurant...he truly has the magic touch!  We made a reservation on a Thursday evening pretty early and the restaurant was already packed.  The atmosphere was lively, the decor was beautiful (as always), the service was good and the food was tasty.  We shared a bowl of the chicken soup and shared a Brussels Sprouts pizza with sweet potatoes and a Spiral Ham pizza...both delicious and unique!  I will definitely try the rotisserie chicken next time as it looked delicious too.

sUISCgX6_bS3JXj6RXlmyQ.text: The hummus was amazing with fresh pita. I had the pastrami pizza and it was perfectly crafted. The Gin and Tonic cocktail was made very well. I will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rotisserie Chicken with umami sauce and Brussels sprouts as a side
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami Pizza with aged gruyere

zKG12kNi6-giCZMiw07dRg.text: We had such a great time here. And our server was incredible, so helpful and fun. The food was on point, I had the chop salad with chicken -- amazing, highly recommend it, though next time I'll get the dressing on the side because it was rather drenched.

mLYYEVJmcz7ZbIjRzTSWJA.text: We loved it!   The place just has a great, open feel with a pleasant, modern decor.  Not too noisy... good energy but could still enjoy good conversation.  Service was enthusiastic, friendly and professional.  Fun menu, delicious food (we had pizza and cole slaw, but will try the chicken next time!), and bathrooms were spotless (to us, that indicates good management and attention to detail).

8z2O6FSFf7sI7-OS-PQlZA.text: Cute name great place to have a great meal. Just make sure to call in for a reservation. Fifth day they were open a friend of mine and I decided to check it out. We had to wait almost 1 hour for a table and there must have been 10 tables available. But no one would give a table. Finally we got to try it out and we split a pizza and a ice tea. Then on 7/8/17 I made a reservation for 2 @ 4:45 we arrived and there must have been 15 tables open and within 35 minutes every table was filled with happy and hunger patrons.  I sat at a table looking towards the kitchen and was amazed on how well the waiters and waitresses keep from running into each other. I complimented Martin Granillo the restaurant manager on how his staff had impressed me.  Now on the food review the Free Range Half Chicken was very tasty. I ordered mine with the Greek yogurt feta sauce and my friend had the garlic one and OMG they both were very yummy. I really like this place because it is very family friendly and so is the staff. Keep up the great work.

L14uWbslz6N0HSS6vQhdzA.text: Not a very good place to go eat.  Service was horrible. We came in party of four. First waitress took out drink and food order, then 10 minutes later change to a different waitress.  Our salads came out. Ok nothing great simple Caesar  salad.  Then we wait for more than 30 min for a pie and a chicken sandwich.  Which the 2nd waitress wasn't aware of our dinner order, thinking we only had the salads for dinner.  No one apologize management never came over to say anything.  Food mediocre service need a bit more training.  Won't be returning back.

d9BGzSkpmC4aCvXplyKyVQ.text: The good is fresh and fantastic.  Service is great. I had the rotisserie chicken with the lemon and roasted garlic sauce.  OMG was my mouth singing!  Do not pass this place up anymore...... it is a must do!

2K1msqm24D6-2eMSEdKkdA.text: The salad was great and the pizza was good. Upscale lunch place for Fox and it was quite busy the day I went. The service was awesome. We sat at the bar and the bartender was there for anything we needed. The only complaint was it was pretty noisy.

UN14c99getZAd9BvIRfnqA.text: Fox does it again..Thought it was a strange name at first but makes sense now. Menu is primarily pizza and rotisserie chicken. A few entree worthy salads one of which I had but the only thing I didn't try was any of the appetizers. Ill bring friends and definitley have the 4 cheese Stromboli. This was a lazy Sunday night dinner but I still wanted to try everything. I had the spiced bourbon cocktail (twice) . They close at 930 but the place was packed at 9. Original plan was grabbing a drink while waiting for a pie but all the food was being prepared on the other side of the bar and I wanted to try everything. Ended up having the apple goat cheese salad. Sipped on my bourbon ancho Reyes combo and had a few slices of the pizzas. Generous portions, the combo could've easily fed two. NIce mixture of crisp apple slices with sliced grape and roasted pecans or almonds. Plenty of non- traditional pizzas to choose from. I had the Asian chicken which was on a bed of cabbage  cilantro and jalapeno.The sauce wasn't heavy but hit the spot. Just a heads up it was a mixture of dark meat and white meat on the pie. Not shocking but different. The pizza variety and cocktails reminded me of The Parlor but with a twist. I'll try out the rotisserie chicken and some of the sandwiches in the near future. The staff was are all very friendly. The hostess even noticed my card fell across the counter and walked all the way around from the front just to pick it up and put it back the in the glass. William was one of the bartenders that covered diners at the bar and definitley was on top of his game. Both managers on staff for the night paid close attention to dishes as they came out and definitley multi tasked dealing with customers and servers. Good meal money well spent!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Asian chicken pizza
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple goat cheese always amazing combo
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tempted to try the Margarita but spicy cocktails with bourbon hard to say no

AtQIarLCN5QDepaetDRFTA.text: This place is different from what I expected. I initially was thinking it would be super fancy but I love the ambiance and my waiter was awesome. The service was pretty great and the pizza was ok. The salad however was AMAZING! I had a Chicken and Avocado salad and to die for. I def will be a frequent just because of the salad.

bjVNCBOB-CaAsgSy9SsNHg.text: Another win for the fox restaurants! Was super excited about the opening of Doughbird and was not disappointed when I dropped in.   I started with a bourbon & bells cocktail made by William, which was sooo good. Don't be thrown off by the bell peppers, give it a try.   We ordered a half chicken with asparagus and broccolini as our side along with the jalapeno pesto for the sauce. The chicken was cooked perfectly! So juicy and full of flavor. We also ordered the Bacon & Truffled Eggs. The pizza had scrambled eggs on top and it was AMAZING!   Waited on by William at the bar and he was very nice and had a lot of good recommendations. I'd try to make a reservation ahead of time, it was packed when we dropped in.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon &amp; Truffled Eggs
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half chicken with asparagus and broccolini
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bourbon &amp; bells

UWikf9e6iSbQyXH_0FPaJA.text: This is my new favorite restaurant. I went twice in one week. First visit was a quick lunch with a friend and I had the prosciutto and goat cheese pizza- it was great! She had the chicken avocado salad and for such a basic salad it was full of flavor- we both loved it. I brought the leftovers home to my husband and he loved it and insisted we returned. We went back on a Saturday for an early dinner at 5. I got the prime rib and he got the goat cheese and prosciutto pizza again. The prime rib was so so good. It was so tender and flavorful. For dessert we got the lemon meringue pie and the warm butterscotch cake- both were delicious but the lemon meringue was the best I've ever had. The cocktails look really good, I'm pregnant so I didn't partake, but I will I'm the future. Service was fast and the restaurant was full by the time we left at 6.

TJLa43vGdlUDPnH0i84Uag.text: This place is fantastic for a casual dinner with a friend or two. Our server was so friendly and super knowledgeable about the menu. I love that their menu is small - we always think we want more choices, but most often that's not really the case (think about the last time you had to look at a Cheesecake Factory Menu! Ugh! Wayyyy too many choices!!)  I got the half bird with a side of mac 'n cheese. Mac 'n Cheese tasted homemade. Rotisserie chicken was cooked to perfection. Added a lemon garlic sauce that was to die for.  My friend got one of the pizzas and said it was perfection. We also both split the number one listed dessert - so yummy!  Fox Concepts never disappoints!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4z1yUf0cUkGAO7jhf400Vg.text: It was nice to see a Fox Concept without Valet parking. The food was phenomenal but the open concept was very noisy which did make conversation a little difficult. I had the watermelon daiquiri mixed drink. It isn't frozen. Very refreshing. If you are not a fan of tart, stay clear. We ordered The Aviator pizza, half bird with mac n cheese plus and order of potato wedges. And last a watermelon heirloom tomato salad. Every single dish was so flavorful. Plenty leftovers for two people. No room for desert. The Elvis did sounds pretty tempting...but we were stuffed!

NDA_rrt8dg4d0_-SEe-62g.text: My rating is a 3.5.  The atmosphere and decor of the new Dough Bird are great and we were excited for our first visit.  The food is solid and we look forward to trying more menu items. The cauliflower mash was delicious and the margarita pizza with burrata was simple yet tasty with a yummy well done crust.  Their signature sauces were good, but not as spectacular as I imagined.  The shishito peppers were good, but I prefer the same dish at Windsor.  Here's the slight downside beyond the slight disappointment with the sauces- the price of drinks. 4 draft beers cost us $25 which pricy for mid-day happy hour time.  Overall, the service and food are reasons enough to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shishito peppers
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita pizza with burrata cheese
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House infused chili oil

BYuj5CRlUnHvsvOvsrFS4g.text: Went here with my dad for an early lunch when I was back in town. We were some of the first people in the restaurant at 11:30am on a Saturday but by the time we left there was a wait for a table. We both ordered drinks; my dad a Kilt Lifter (in a can) and I ordered The Local. Top marks for my drink - I'm not a vodka person but the drink was extremely fresh and not too bitter. We split the Crispy Pastrami pizza and the Prime Rib Dip. They were both fantastic! Our waiter also recommended the Jamaican Jerk Marmalade which complemented the pizza (and the fries, mmm) well.  The whole vibe here is exactly what I expect when I go to an FRC (and having just moved from Scottsdale I believe I've been to most of them): quality, trendy, delicious. Keep it up - and keep 'em coming to Irvine!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pizza was so good I forgot to snap a pic before we started eating.
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The restaurant before it gets crazy!

loomuyS0OSxJJfiM527Yew.text: It is a pretty nice place. Decent prices. The staff is really nice and attentive. I like curry and they have really good curry. Some of their pizzas might be a little bit dry but they are very tasty. The establishment and restrooms are really clean.

8HVQ2IiIljZWLhI8OliTlQ.text: Tried this cool and trendy place for lunch. Had the 1/2 free range chicken. Great flavor. Will be back for sure to try the dough part. Only bad thing was that parking is a bit difficult.  One more thing, a place like this should NEVER serve Pepsi. What a sellout. Usually B and C rated restaurants do so to save money, but still, I can't dock them a full star for that so just know this is really a 4 1/2.

qqBEtT_sB_bLbrr1sXSf3w.text: First visit to DoughBird and despite it being open for only 30 mins there was already a 20 min wait so we grabbed so bar seats instead (great place to watch the kitchen!) Anyways the service was great per usual at a Sam Fox restaurant but the food was just ok/good nothing that we had to write home about. We had garden chop with chicken that could have used a few more pieces of chicken and half order of chicken with umami & mac and cheese. The chicken was good but the skin was star- super tasty and flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-MYbpsOR7QpO77ovjz25Nw.text: Our table was a collection of local work friends enjoying time together post work. Entry was controlled drama due to its busyness that actually elevated the start-off experience. Once in, waiter started cordial then would begin to forget items of exception with orders. With much surrounding competition walk away census with food/service was unimpressed.

LD92B3Z16xpgyKzKc6jieg.text: This place is loud and I mean so loud you can't hear the person a few inches from your ear and yelling at you loud, got things we didn't even order and then had to pay for, mind you I have been here more then 3 times as my mother likes to bring guest here, each time I get served with an alcoholic beverage but I have asked for it to be virgin as health is a concern, food is normally brought out mixed temperature and service can be a hassle as no one  is attentive. I hope my mother will stop bringing her guest.

3kEC_tcVsr5nYL4IfDpPCA.text: As the newest restaurant of the Fox Concepts, Doughbird has a lot of potential. They have really friendly staff and quick service. The environment itself is fantastic too; I loved the vibes and decorations inside the restaurant.   In terms of food, they lived up to the "Dough" portion of the name, but could improve upon the "Bird" part. The Barbecue Beef pizza was my favorite item from our lunch. They nailed the consistency of the crust, and the corn and cilantro toppings really finished the pizza. They also balanced the sauces (BBQ, pesto & creamy goat cheese) so nothing was overwhelming.   I also enjoyed the Pastrami Sandwich, which looked like a torta. The pastrami was thinly sliced and flavorful -- I added some Jamaican Jerk Marmalade to it, which made it even better!   Finally, the whole chicken was good, but not very consistent. Some pieces were cooked evenly, yet still juicy, but other pieces were still undercooked. Apart from that, they had really zesty sauces to add on top -- I really liked the Jamaican Jerk, but wasn't a fan of the Umami Sauce (it was too citrus-y for me).

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Whole bird with Brussels sprouts &amp; Kale
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pastrami Sandwich with fries
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbecue Beef Pizza -- DELICIOUS!

bBybEKlhVgQRnwnb5HD7Ww.text: Wasn't quite sure what to expect, as it's an odd combination - pizza and rotisserie chicken - but was really impressed. Tried the buffalo chicken sandwich, and the chicken was done perfectly, with just the right amount of buffalo sauce and cheese, and even the bread was good. The pizza was delicious as well. Tried the rotisserie chicken with Jamaican jerk marmalade, which was phenomenal. Wish they bottled it for take home. Great find. Can't wait to go back.

QUSZ9bxAkPi4kr4sgCxSaw.text: Everything was so great from the moment we walked in, until the moment we left. We came on a not so busy Saturday around 4pm in which they were running happy hour so we sat at a high top. We only ordered the wings off the happy hour menu, they were pretty tasty just wish they were fresh. I know it's hard to not prebake or fry wings because it takes longer to make but they just taste so much better. We shared the chicken avocado salad which was AMAZING. I have been craving it since. Between the bacon, the chicken, the avocado there was enough of everything (and a very generous portion). We got the pepperoni and fresh Moz pizza which we also enjoyed. We were so full but just kept eating and eating it was just that great. We will definitely be back to try more of the menu items. Since you can see the whole back counter we did notice some other things weren't fresh. For instance the prime rib dip looked great but it was previously frozen so once again, just misses that freshness taste. We have been to many fox restaurants and haven't noticed that so maybe it's just this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

duptPInzBUEH1O1fvLkl2g.text: We are devoted fans of FRC restaurants,  so my family expected and wanted to Love Doughbird!  As typical for Fox restaurants the space is beautiful,  bright and cheery.  The service was wonderful,  all staff were professional and friendly = 2 Stars.  Sadly, the meals we ate during our 1st visit missed the mark.  My husband was looking forward to their prime rib sandwich.  He was disappointed that it came out very dry, while relatively plentiful,  the meat was overcooked,  laced with fat and gristle.   I had the barbecue chicken pizza.  The pizza looked good,  but it was lukewarm and very very greasy.  The outer crust was good but the inner crust was so soggy it was difficult to eat without using a knife and fork.  The pizza had okay flavor but the whole texture threw me off.  Our daughter had the quarter chicken kids meal.  It came with a very small leg and half thigh with wing attached.  The chicken was good,  she liked the leg portion and the chicken I cut off the thigh.  The wing portion got set aside.  The corn served with the kids meal was alot of broken kernels that resulted in a mush texture she didn't like.  We shared the Elvis parfait and butterscotch cake.  Those were okay,  but not anything we would want to order again.  We may try Doughbird again,  but with so many other options,  it is not likely.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kw444XMHYv_R2rBw-kc2_A.text: Some of the best pizza I have had in a while!! The service was super fast and the atmosphere is really fun. The rotisserie chicken is also amazing, we got it with the Jamaican jerk sauce and it was really good

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NyOE49LI7jT7C8ETtL9Y5g.text: So today I shared the Heirloom Tomato Watermelon salad  and chicken wings - I received the email earlier in the day about the summer salad. The picture in the email looks great. Don't get me wrong the salad was good however based on the name I would have expected more than 3 cubes of watermelon and 4 pieces of tomatoes.  Our waiter was amazing as all of the staff there. Was a bit disappointed in the salad.

YHOROmnMcAY3OnrgBYxuzw.text: I don't know maybe I came on a bad night.  I thought the chicken was small and lacked flavor.  Service was mediocre to bad and place was very crowded.  I actually considered making a run to Costco and selling some real tasty rotisserie chicken in the parking lot.  I mean I figure with what Fox was getting, I should be able to get a double on every Costco chicken.  Chicken Arbitrage.  Well I haven't phoned the manager subsequent to seeing her reply, but can't get a classier reply to a negative review.  Props for your reply.

a2ra7r5YL6G8bIUQxZSWXg.text: Great place for pizza and chicken... :P We actually went there for a quick lunch.  My friend and I ordered the Garden Chopped Salad, which was delish.  Super fresh, crunchy greens, and a delicious dressing.  The waitress was kind enough to bring extra plates so that we can share the salad (which was definitely good enough for two).  We also ordered a gluten free pizza, the Prosciutto & Goat Cheese pizza to be exact.  I forgot, while I was eating, that the crust was gluten free.  Baked to perfection and the combination of flavors was a pleasant surprise.  The waitress was very knowledgable and pleasant to deal with, and super attentive.  The atmosphere was nice: no loud music and plenty of natural light (I sometimes have trouble with dark restaurants).  We did not try the rotisserie chicken, but cannot wait to try it as it did look awesome at the table next to us.  I would more than definitely try this place again!

Cjy5CteaYbVxGIRGnBemxQ.text: Another great Fox Concept restaurant! Food was delicious and service was good. Interior decor is beautiful at this location. I had the BBQ chicken pizza and it was superb!

ZYQdJHEoZPMjLTEUyuMPfw.text: Met some girlfriend for lunch & this place is amazing!!   The service was awesome!    The food was fast!      We all ordered salads.   I got the chopped salad with chicken on it!   The quality of food is amazing!   We also got the hummus & a side of veggies to dip.   Yum!!  I ordered a chicken to take home to the fam!   They loved it!     I cannot wait to go back with my hubs & branch out a bit.   Their pizzas look amazing!   I've been told they have the best gluten free crust!  Can't wait!

nOjhgZqG3nrCFPPNtFFeFg.text: The reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is cause we waited about 30 mins to an hour to be seated and it was 7pm. Then we ordered and it took forever another hour so by the time we left it was about 9pm.   We all basically got chicken which I should have got something else so we can try other stuff from the menu. We got the free ranged chicken which comes with a sauce and a side, wish it came with 2 sides. I got mashed potatoes and lemon garlic sauce and a side of broccoli. The chicken skin was sweet which I don't like my food sweet. Also the skin had a lot of seasoning on it. But the inside was good and juicy. Honestly probably could have got a Walmart rotisserie chicken when it's fresh and could have saved so much money.   Next time I would try other stuff like their pizza.   Also for appetizer we got the truffled cheese bread it was  delicious. The sauce was a different type of marinara but it was good. There was about 8 pieces cut into pizza slices.   They do have happy hour.   It's cute inside. There is a bar area to sit at.   Also when you check in they send you a text when your table is ready.   Also if you sign up for emails from them you get $10 off.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kitchen
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

2VMDACoFLsxBpXLp5m58_Q.text: Fox Restaurant Concepts does it again... this time with a colorful, spacious and fun pizza and rotisserie restaurant with the perfect name!  I've been a handful of times to Doughbird and experienced dining in for lunch, dining in for dinner, and also take-out dinner.  Doughbird works for a meal with friends, colleagues, family, or even a date.  It's conveniently located on the southwest corner of Indian School and 44th St. in a strip mall.  Parking can be challenging at busy times.  In addition to pizza and chicken, the salads and sides are delicious!  I'm a fan of the potatoes and the cauliflower as well as the Garden Chop Salad.  Lots of fun sauces too!    Doughbird also offers a great cocktail / drink menu and happy hour prices from 2pm - 5pm daily in the bar.  (I'm a fan of The Local and the Raven & Geary Margarita).  Their kids menu is moderately priced as well and includes pizza, mac & cheese, and 1/4 rotisserie chicken.  What more do you need?  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sides of Cauliflower Mash and Crispy Potato Wedges
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garden Chop salad

2rj3YO3zh-XD8MZChErX2w.text: Inside dining room is airy and bright. Service was friendly. Had the margherita pizza and half rotisserie chicken. The two dishes were enough to share amongst 3 adults. Pizza was very flavorful but not cooked enough for my liking - more doughy than crispy. Next time I will ask them to leave in oven a bit longer. The chicken was moist and juicy. Had the terriyaki sauce and crispy potato wedges to accompany and both were yummy.

OkLf8vQiegutSz0wysletA.text: Excellent pizza! Wood fired, quality toppings on a perfectly fired crust! Doesn't get much better than an authentic margherita pizza! Doughbird has this one down! Fresh mozzarella, fresh basil that infuses it's bright flavor to the last bite! But what makes. Pizza great, beside it's crust... THE SAUCE! Wow, amazing!  We also tried the wild mushroom with black truffle, it was SO DELICIOUS, Hubby got the aviator, basically a meat pizza! All of them were incredible!  We didn't get the bird, but next time we'll try it! It looked amazing as we could see many dishes coming out of the open kitchen! (Which I love! I could sit at the bar with a glass of wine, or bottle, and watch them cook all day!) Excellent service and experience! A+

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9o31ZKElK1wged7nbAy8EA.text: Lively atmosphere,  nice decor, outdoor seating with misters, nice views of Camelback mountain, good service.       Food:   We tried the rotisserie chicken (a little dry), the Barbeque Chicken Pizza (great toppings), and the Wild Mushroom Pizza (very flavorful).     For dessert we had The Elvis and the Warm Butterscotch Cream Cake.   They satisfied our sweet tooth but were not memorable.      We had a nice evening with friends and will return if we are in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Doughbird - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good pizza

LCURMgJb47iRAMHgaHkheQ.text: Great little Phoenix pizza joint. Good mix drinks. Great pizzas and cute atmosphere. Stop In for happy hr

ccIe3gMW0S4XGSL3RGvjcQ.text: I've been here a few times and really like it. I'd call it an upscale family restaurant...but think well-behaved 8-14-year-olds, not crying babies or 2-year-olds. I was there on a date and did see other people there on dates, so don't let the family thing scare you away.  I haven't tried the pizza but of course, it looks good. The Truffled Cheese Bread was delicious but was really expensive for the portion size. I didn't compare the price but we probably could have gotten a small pizza for the same price. I've ordered a few things from time to time which featured Truffle oil. I really don't see what's so special about it. My date just gobbled most of the cheesy bread down and seemed to be in cheese heaven, so actually, I would consider ordering it again.   The BBQ Chicken salad was really delicious. Just the right amount of dressing. I have a pet peeve about too much dressing. The BBQ chicken had a rich smokey flavor and was delicious when it was served and as a leftover.  This is a part of the Fox Concept Restaurant group. I guess the chicken is what makes this more than a pizza place. It's definitely worth trying and you can make a reservation...which makes it easier to go to than some other Fox restaurant choices.     Note: Costco has restaurant cards you can buy for the Fox Concept Restaurants. It's $80 for $100 worth of food. Well worth keeping in your wallet or purse if you like several of their restaurants.

L07jm8_l8vGJ5ofXc9EKbQ.text: I love the Doughbird, especially the atmosphere. You can always find a good meal here, especially the chicken.  I have not had many other options besides the rotisserie chicken, but I am always satisfied with my decision. I did however have a chipotle BBQ side sauce and definitely was not my favorite.    I have wanted to try a pizza for a while now and the next time I go i hopefully will. They always look so fresh and tasty when they walk past me!

YXl18BIbcrdHFXyYSlwiGA.text: Dougbird is one of my favorite restaurants in phoenix. The only reason I'm giving it a 4/5 is because of how full the restaurant remains.   The food is delicious and the staff do everything they can to make sure you are having a pleasant dining experience.

OmB5AI95OJu0Wx5d0NCohw.text: Early dinner Sunday night. First time here. Had very high expectations due to Yelp reviews, we were not disappointed. Started with apple goat cheese salad. Told our very nice server we were sharing. Salad arrived on separate plates, generous portion, plenty for two. Fresh greens, crisp apple slices, sliced grapes, delicious. Thin, crusty sausage and mushroom pizza followed. Chewy style crust, slight char, some really nicely glazed mushrooms and tasty sausage. Then came one half rotisserie chicken, which I carved for us. Moist, fresh tasting, quality bird. Came with outstanding crisp potato wedges and the very best pineapple teriyaki sauce we've had. Flavor so intense, it was over the top delicious.  We were full, and had leftovers, but wanted to try the almond Joy trifle dessert. So rich we couldn't finish it. Whipped cream, chocolate, coconut.  Restaurant very well styled. Clean, comfy, modern, unpretentious. Still felt upscale and just a tad trendy. Nicely done. Our server was friendly and efficient. Only criticism...they didn't have to charge $3.50 for bar draw club soda. Cost them about 5 cents. Other than that, healthy, clean, pleasant meal. Wife said it was Delightful! I agree.

HduA1_7je_KGEwxGdgBGBw.text: Generally speaking, I love getting restaurant gift cards for Christmas.  Particularly locally based restaurants.  But for those of you who know me or read my reviews, you are well aware of my love/hate relationship with Sam Fox.  As I've said in the past, it comes down to three things (1) beautiful spaces, (2) average food, (3) outrageous prices.  So I usually parse my restaurant gift card requests by (politely) asking people to abstain from giving me Fox Restaurant gift cards.  But low and behold my grandmother's gift for Christmas this year was (you guessed it) a Fox gift card.  Welp, I've never been to Doughbird.  And even though I had no plans to visit anytime soon, might as well put the gift card to use.  On the southwest corner of 44th Street and Indian School, Sam Fox's newest invention Doughbird is a space devoted to two seemingly unrelated cuisines.  Pizza and Rotisserie items.  I mean, sure I like both of those things in the abstract.  But why combine these two?  Beats me.  The restaurant is fairly spacious and can probably accommodate upwards of 150 (including the outside patio) at full capacity.  And supposedly its always full here so I decided to come here for an early dinner on a Friday.  Good decision on my part as things began to fill quickly thereafter.  The space, like so many of Sam Fox's creations, is gorgeous.  The blue and white contemporary tiles on the ground invoke memories of the The Henry's setup while the spacious yet elegant main dining room area harkens towards a feel similar to that of Arrogant Butcher and Flower Child.  The one standout setup here is the open kitchen.  Good for me as I sat up the bar to get a front row seat at the beehive of activity as dozens of staff from cooks, to wait staff, to bartenders somehow navigate the chaos.  As I arrived during happy hour, there were drink specials.  And with their Little Bird Sangria half off during happy hour, that seemed like a good place to start.  Slightly more tart than other red sangrias I've had, but not heavy and with just enough alcohol to give it that perfect kick.  For my main dish, I was looking to meld both the dough and the bird.  Surprisingly there aren't many items on their menu that meld both concepts on one dish.  One of the few is the Barbecue Chicken pizza.  And yes, I know California Pizza Kitchen among many others have done some version of this, but I tried Doughbird's version anyway.  Doughbird's uses chicken hot from their own rotisserie, corn, red onion, white cheddar, greens, mozzarella, oregano, tomatoes, and jalapeno pesto on their version.  Its not strictly speaking a Neapolitan style preparation, but its a close approximation.  And quite tasty I will admit.  The pesto brings a slow simmering spice to each bite and the mix of cheeses holds everything together.  I don't really get the corn other than perhaps to add a sweet element, but it didn't do anything for me.  Overall though, a good pizza with a good crust to match.  Lastly, I inquired about dessert.  The waitress up front (without a moments hesitation) told me to order the Almond Joy Trifle.  Chocolate mousse on the bottom, layered with coconut, almond toffee, and topped with whipped cream.  Super rich as you'd imagine and a great combination at that.  I  tried like hell to get pieces of every layer in every bite, but it was a messy proposition.  Maybe serve this in a banana split type setup?  Just a thought.  Otherwise, no complaints about this sweet treat.  Total cost for the food, drink, tax, and tip came to $35.  While not perfect, I will give Sam Fox my initial vote of confidence.  Doughbird is a decent and promising concept.  So okay thanks Grandma, your Christmas gift card was useful after all.  The menu is not revolutionary by any means and the reasons for mixing two unrelated cuisines into one concept is still puzzling to me, but the effort here seems a bit more genuine than some of the other Fox spots.  The space is beautiful, the food is tasty, and the prices are (mostly) fair.  Here's hoping those are the three things I'll be able to associate with future Sam Fox concepts.

3RGOOrT5KM_vKdIJ_YkzCg.text: Love, love, love this place. It is beautifully decorated, beautiful bar, comfortable seats. They have great mixed drinks and a great wine list. I crave the rotisserie chicken and jalapeno sauce all the time. My husband loves the pizza and salad. For him to eat salad is a big deal, so that's saying a lot! The reason we go, above all, is Hunter. He is the most amazing bartender and server and makes the experience! I would love to see more side options with the chicken. I also miss the original bread that was offered when Doughbird opened. It was less dense. Also, PLEASE bring back the happy hour pizza slice. It was everything!

hUUZ6ZbedsiwKmhSZGAUUw.text: Our first time experience was perfect! I made a reservation on open table but we arrived way ahead of time and the hostess was happy to get us in earlier! Everyone who took care of us was delightful and sweet. The menu was amazing, everything made fresh from the kitchen. The sweet potato Brussels sprout pizza was AMAZING. Great atmosphere as well. If we lived closer it would definitely be a must go to every week.

aBGKkSZ9AdOOsmqq1P8ymg.text: It was my family's first time here. It was busy but the service was good and quick. The food was yummy. We got a little of everything. I got the chicken bacon avocado sandwich and it was good but the bread was a little thick compared to the contents inside the sandwich. Overall, we enjoyed it The cocktails were really good. And 3 mixed drinks got my 6'4, 200 lbs self faded! Haha Thanks Doughbirds

to2F4tTIzmAzDMOq98PE8A.text: Doughbird had been on my list for quite some time. Glad I finally got a chance to check it out recently. Visited with our party of four and started off with the guacamole and chips. It was different the way they make it and good, but not a huge fan necessarily. Next time I'd try their hummus. We had some beers and a couple glasses of wine, love their Riesling! I was not in the mood for Pizza but I did order the Margherita as it's a fave of mine and I didn't feel like a salad or cauliflower steak for dinner (vegetarian here). The pizza was good but not great. Apparently I realized that I have become a pizza snob. I like really tasty sauce and amazing cheese all throughout along with a good crust that's not too hard, tasteless or falling apart. Most places don't blow me away with their pizza and I think I'm still looking for the next restaurant that will. Although it was good, to me I was left with too much crust (near the outside of the dough) without sauce or cheese. If I wanted to eat plain dough, I'd do that at home. Overall I will say the BBQ chicken pizza and the Aviator pizza looked freaking amazing! And it smelled great too, but mine was not exactly what I was hoping for. Nevertheless, my gf got a 1/2 chicken w/mac and cheese (yummy mac and cheese) and we finished the night off with the butterscotch cake a la mode. The service was lovely, attentive and I loved the ambiance. Overall I feel I'd go back but probably sit at the bar, order some drinks and take advantage of some appetizers at 1/2 price. It was a nice experience overall.

0qMKrKvY1cyC3W1LG2Boow.text: How do you unapologetically destroy pizza and chicken when those are the two main things you serve?  I used to love doughbird, but service and good quality has gone downhill. When they opened, the burrata and pepperoni was awesome, chicken was fresh, but early on they changed to mozzarella and the chicken (half of what they're supposed to be known for) is so dry and old that it isnt even edible. I think they used to do team service and a manager made sure everything was alright, but now it's literally zero service.  Tonight took the cake, full decline status: - walked in at 8 on a Saturday. Slightly busy, 6-7 open tables. Told hostess we had a party of 2 and she whispered unintelligible and then we just stood there in silence for 5 minutes. - ordered a kid's cheese pizza and Caesar salad with chicken - food took about 15 minutes, pizza was burned and salad had 3 old dry looking pieces of dark meat. Maybe a half teaspoon of dressing and no cheese. It was basically a small bowl of wilted old lettuce. - it took about 7 minutes to make eye contact with the server and ask for a side of dressing, side of park and some white meat. - dressing and cheese added flavor, but this chicken that came out had to be 4 days old. So dry, inedible. - took 15 minutes for server to come back again. The other two tables next to us also looked like they were ready to go 20 minutes ago. - FINALLY got the check and, to add insult to injury, had been charged for 2 sides of chicken. Didn't say a word because we knew she wasn't going to be back any time soon (restaurant was empty at this point).  Better food quality and service at a chain restaurant.  Gonna miss this place. :(

RNXlJ8nb0Ry5cWhdaHFvDg.text: We went here to celebrate my husband's and my birthday this past Saturday. We had an earlier dinner at 4:30 and no wait! Our waitress was awesome, and even offered to make us a new pizza when my husband forgot to ask to remove an ingredient from the pizza.  Salads were very flavorful with quite a few good options. I loved the chicken/avocado salad. Pizzas were all good - the crust is almost like a flatbread (thicker and fluffier). Our family shared the following pizza's and loved them all: The Aviator, Prosciutto and Goat Cheese, Margherita, and Brussels Sprout. Only complaint is it all feels a bit overpriced, but we would still come back!

tc_182ZDLXXv9ZX4roDuRg.text: Wow! This place is outstanding Sam from Fox concepts out did himself again! Rotisserie chicken and pizza! Great cocktails great desserts great service! I am a huge fan of this place now. Outstanding service truly very well coordinated with everything. Had the pleasure of having great service by Hunter, great service w/ a great smile!

The pizzas are so interesting - we tried the Brussel sprout and 1/2 a chicken... Yum!  The grilled cauliflower side dish was fantastic.
